title: Amulet
data:
**[English]()**

 • [русский](/wiki/Amulet/ru "Amulet/ru")

 • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Amulet/zh-CN "Amulet/zh-CN")

| **[Item](/wiki/Item "Item") classes**          |                                        |   |
| ---------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------- | - |
| [" Amulets]()                                  | [\[ Armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor")        |   |
| [% Comestibles](/wiki/Comestible "Comestible") | [$ Coins](/wiki/Coin "Coin")           |   |
| [\* Gems](/wiki/Gem "Gem")                     | [! Potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion")     |   |
| [= Rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring")                   | [? Scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll")     |   |
| [+ Spellbooks](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook")    | [\` Statues](/wiki/Statue "Statue")    |   |
| [( Tools](/wiki/Tool "Tool")                   | [\` Boulders](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder") |   |
| [) Weapons](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon")             | [/ Wands](/wiki/Wand "Wand")           |   |

An **amulet**, also known as a **medallion**, is a type of [item](/wiki/Item "Item") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* and is represented by a cyan [double quotation mark](/wiki/Double_quotation_mark "Double quotation mark"), ".

There are two [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") amulets: [The Eye of the Aethiopica](/wiki/The_Eye_of_the_Aethiopica "The Eye of the Aethiopica") and the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Table of amulets](#Table_of_amulets)

- [4 Identification](#Identification)

- [5 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [6.2 FIQHack](#FIQHack)

- [7 Encyclopaedia entry](#Encyclopaedia_entry)

- [8 References](#References)

## Generation

Amulets comprise 1% of all randomly-generated items in the main dungeon, 1% in containers, and 4% in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"). The second column above is the relative probability of each subtype.

The ones generated 90.5% cursed are 9% uncursed and 0.5% blessed. All others are generated 5% cursed, 90% uncursed, 5% blessed.

The Amulet of Yendor is a [unique item](/wiki/Unique_item "Unique item") found only in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"), with fake counterparts appearing on the [Rogue level](/wiki/Rogue_level "Rogue level"), in the inventories of certain high-level monsters, and in the bones files of people who had a real or fake Amulet themselves, where the real Amulet is replaced with a fake one.

## Description

All amulets have a [weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight") of 20, are made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), and have a base price of 150 [zorkmids](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid"), with the exception of [cheap plastic imitations of the Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Cheap_plastic_imitations_of_the_Amulet_of_Yendor "Cheap plastic imitations of the Amulet of Yendor") (made of [plastic](/wiki/Plastic "Plastic") and worth nothing) and [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") amulets.

Amulets are [put on](/wiki/Put_on "Put on") around the wearer's neck, and a [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") wearing the amulet will burn an extra 1 point of [nutrition](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition") every 20 turns.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Carrying the Amulet of Yendor consumes an additional 1 nutrition per 20 turns, regardless of whether the character is wearing it.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Wearing a [cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Cheap_plastic_imitation_of_the_Amulet_of_Yendor "Cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor") no longer incurs amulet hunger.

## Table of amulets

| Amulet                                                                                                                                                     | Relative probability | When eaten                                                       | Notes                                                                                   |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [amulet of change](/wiki/Amulet_of_change "Amulet of change")                                                                                              | 13.0%                | Changes [gender](/wiki/Gender "Gender")                          | 90.5% generated cursed                                                                  |
| [amulet of ESP](/wiki/Amulet_of_ESP "Amulet of ESP")                                                                                                       | 17.5%                | [Telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy")                         |                                                                                         |
| [amulet of life saving](/wiki/Amulet_of_life_saving "Amulet of life saving")                                                                               | 7.5%                 | *(no effect)*                                                    |                                                                                         |
| [amulet of magical breathing](/wiki/Amulet_of_magical_breathing "Amulet of magical breathing")                                                             | 6.5%                 | [Breathlessness](/wiki/Breathless "Breathless")                  |                                                                                         |
| [amulet of reflection](/wiki/Amulet_of_reflection "Amulet of reflection")                                                                                  | 7.5%                 | *(no effect)*                                                    |                                                                                         |
| [amulet of restful sleep](/wiki/Amulet_of_restful_sleep "Amulet of restful sleep")                                                                         | 13.5%                | Restful sleep                                                    | 90.5% generated cursed                                                                  |
| [amulet of strangulation](/wiki/Amulet_of_strangulation "Amulet of strangulation")                                                                         | 13.5%                | Instantly [choke](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")                   | 90.5% generated cursed                                                                  |
| [amulet of unchanging](/wiki/Amulet_of_unchanging "Amulet of unchanging")                                                                                  | 4.5%                 | Revert to original form                                          |                                                                                         |
| [amulet versus poison](/wiki/Amulet_versus_poison "Amulet versus poison")                                                                                  | 16.5%                | [Poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") |                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                            |                      |                                                                  |                                                                                         |
| [cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Cheap_plastic_imitation_of_the_Amulet_of_Yendor "Cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor") | 0                    | *(inedible)*                                                     |                                                                                         |
| [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor")                                                                                              | 0                    | *(inedible)*                                                     | Cannot be put in a [container](/wiki/Container "Container")                             |
| [The Eye of the Aethiopica](/wiki/The_Eye_of_the_Aethiopica "The Eye of the Aethiopica")                                                                   | —                    | [Telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy")                         | [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") |

Most amulets can be [eaten](/wiki/Eating_jewelry "Eating jewelry") by polymorphing into a [metallivore](/wiki/Metallivore "Metallivore"). Eaten amulets have a 1⁄5 chance of applying their effect permanently, except for the amulet of strangulation, which has a 19⁄20 chance of choking you unless you are [unbreathing](/wiki/Unbreathing "Unbreathing").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

The following new amulets were added. Both auto-identify when worn, except the amulet of flying if you were already flying. The probabilities of other amulets have been adjusted: ESP to 12%; strangulation, restful sleep, versus poison, change to 11.5%; live saving, magical breathing to 7.5%; unchanging to 6%.

| Amulet                                                              | Relative probability | When eaten                                                    | Notes                    |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------ |
| [amulet of flying](/wiki/Amulet_of_flying "Amulet of flying")       | 7.5%                 | *(no effect)*                                                 |                          |
| [amulet of guarding](/wiki/Amulet_of_guarding "Amulet of guarding") | 6.0%                 | +2 [protection](/wiki/Protection "Protection") (+2 AC, +2 MC) | May be worn by monsters. |

## Identification

All amulets cost 150[zm](/wiki/Zm "Zm") and weigh 20, so they cannot be distinguished using [price identification](/wiki/Price_identification "Price identification"). The appearance of the first 9 types of amulet in the table are [randomized](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") from the following descriptions:

```
circular    spherical   oval       
triangular  pyramidal   square 
concave     hexagonal   octagonal
```

Non-cursed amulets are safe to try on; the effect may become obvious after a while, such as for the amulet of ESP, and you can always remove it if it is strangulation or restful sleep. The only risk is a small chance of changing genders, which does not have an effect on gameplay for the most part. Once strangulation and restful sleep are ruled out, even cursed amulets can be worn safely and beneficially as long as you don't have another amulet you'd rather be wearing instead.

Amulets of change and strangulation always formally identify themselves when worn. Every other amulet (other than the real and fake Amulets of Yendor) adds a line to the [enlightenment](/wiki/Enlightenment "Enlightenment") screen, although some lines can have other sources:

| Amulet of...      | produces the line...                         | Other sources                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| ----------------- | -------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| ESP               | "You are telepathic."                        | [Helm of telepathy](/wiki/Helm_of_telepathy "Helm of telepathy"), some quest artifacts, intrinsic                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| life saving       | "Your life will be saved."                   | none                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| magical breathing | "You can survive without air."               | none                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| reflection        | "You have reflection."                       | silver [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail"), [shield of reflection](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection"), wielded [Longbow of Diana](/wiki/Longbow_of_Diana "Longbow of Diana") or wielded [Dragonbane](/wiki/Dragonbane "Dragonbane") (3.6.1) |
| restful sleep     | "You fall asleep."                           | none                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| unchanging        | "You can not change from your current form." | none                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| versus poison     | "You are poison resistant."                  | green [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail"), [ring of poison resistance](/wiki/Ring_of_poison_resistance "Ring of poison resistance"), [alchemy smock](/wiki/Alchemy_smock "Alchemy smock"), intrinsic                                                        |

In addition, [intelligent](/wiki/Intelligent "Intelligent") monsters will only pick up and put on life saving (if living) and reflection.

In NetHack 3.4.3, Amulets of ESP can be identified using the [artifact naming trick](/wiki/Naming_artifacts "Naming artifacts"), because they cannot be named "[The Eye of the Aethiopica](/wiki/The_Eye_of_the_Aethiopica "The Eye of the Aethiopica")". In NetHack 3.6.0, no amulet can be named "The Eye of the Aethiopica", so this method is ineffective at identifying amulets of ESP. Note that it is exploiting a bug that may be fixed in [variants](/wiki/Variant "Variant")—including NAO version of NetHack. Additionally it may be considered [cheating](/wiki/Cheating "Cheating").

The real Amulet of Yendor, unlike the fakes, cannot be placed in a container ("The Amulet of Yendor cannot be confined in such trappings.")

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

The new amulet appearances are pentagonal and cubical.

## Strategy

Amulets cannot be destroyed by electric [shocks](/wiki/Shock "Shock"), so unless stolen by a [nymph](/wiki/Nymph "Nymph") or [monkey](/wiki/Monkey "Monkey") they are reliable at conferring their effect.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds some more amulets.

| Item                                                                                        | Symbol | Base type  | Notes                                                                                                                                             |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------ | ---------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [Amulet of flying](/wiki/Amulet_of_flying "Amulet of flying")                               | "      | Randomized | Grants flight.                                                                                                                                    |
| [Amulet of drain resistance](/wiki/Amulet_of_drain_resistance "Amulet of drain resistance") | "      | Randomized | Grants [level drain resistance](/wiki/Level_drain_resistance "Level drain resistance").                                                           |
| [Amulet versus stone](/wiki/Amulet_versus_stone "Amulet versus stone")                      | "      | Randomized | Saves your life if you're [turned to stone](/wiki/Petrification "Petrification"), then alters its [BUC](/wiki/BUC "BUC") status or disintegrates. |

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack") monsters can wear amulets.

## Encyclopaedia entry

"The complete Amulet can keep off all the things that make people unhappy -- jealousy, bad temper, pride, disagreeableness, greediness, selfishness, laziness. Evil spirits, people called them when the Amulet was made. Don't you think it would be nice to have it?"  
"Very," said the children, quite without enthusiasm.  
"And it can give you strength and courage."  
"That's better," said Cyril.  
"And virtue."  
"I suppose it's nice to have that," said Jane, but not with much interest.  
"And it can give you your heart's desire."  
"Now you're talking," said Robert.

\[ The Story of the Amulet, by Edith Nesbit ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [gethungry](/wiki/Source:Eat.c#gethungry "Source:Eat.c") in [eat.c](/wiki/Source:Eat.c "Source:Eat.c")

*This page is based on a spoiler by [Dylan O'Donnell](https://alt.org/nethack/mirror/www.spod-central.org/%257Epsmith/). The original license is:*

Redistribution, copying, and editing of these spoilers, with or without modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:

1. The original contributors to any spoiler must continue to be credited.
2. Any modifications to the spoiler must be acknowledged and credited.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.1. Click here for more information.](/images/d/d3/Nh361-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.1. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-361}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

Amulet

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • русский

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
Item classes
" Amulets [ Armor
% Comestibles $ Coins
* Gems ! Potions
= Rings ? Scrolls
+ Spellbooks ` Statues
( Tools ` Boulders
) Weapons / Wands

An amulet, also known as a medallion, is a type of item that appears in NetHack and is represented by a cyan double quotation mark, ".

There are two artifact amulets: The Eye of the Aethiopica and the Amulet of Yendor.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Table of amulets
  • 4 Identification
  • 5 Strategy
  • 6 Variants
    • 6.1 SLASH'EM
    • 6.2 FIQHack
  • 7 Encyclopaedia entry
  • 8 References

Generation

Amulets comprise 1% of all randomly-generated items in the main dungeon, 1% in containers, and 4% in Gehennom. The second column above is the relative probability of each subtype.

The ones generated 90.5% cursed are 9% uncursed and 0.5% blessed. All others are generated 5% cursed, 90% uncursed, 5% blessed.

The Amulet of Yendor is a unique item found only in Gehennom, with fake counterparts appearing on the Rogue level, in the inventories of certain high-level monsters, and in the bones files of people who had a real or fake Amulet themselves, where the real Amulet is replaced with a fake one.

Description

All amulets have a weight of 20, are made of iron, and have a base price of 150 zorkmids, with the exception of cheap plastic imitations of the Amulet of Yendor (made of plastic and worth nothing) and artifact amulets.

Amulets are put on around the wearer's neck, and a hero wearing the amulet will burn an extra 1 point of nutrition every 20 turns.[1] Carrying the Amulet of Yendor consumes an additional 1 nutrition per 20 turns, regardless of whether the character is wearing it.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Wearing a cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor no longer incurs amulet hunger.

Table of amulets

Amulet Relative probability When eaten Notes
amulet of change 13.0% Changes gender 90.5% generated cursed
amulet of ESP 17.5% Telepathy
amulet of life saving 7.5% (no effect)
amulet of magical breathing 6.5% Breathlessness
amulet of reflection 7.5% (no effect)
amulet of restful sleep 13.5% Restful sleep 90.5% generated cursed
amulet of strangulation 13.5% Instantly choke 90.5% generated cursed
amulet of unchanging 4.5% Revert to original form
amulet versus poison 16.5% Poison resistance
cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor 0 (inedible)
Amulet of Yendor 0 (inedible) Cannot be put in a container
The Eye of the Aethiopica — Telepathy Wizard quest artifact

Most amulets can be eaten by polymorphing into a metallivore. Eaten amulets have a 1⁄5 chance of applying their effect permanently, except for the amulet of strangulation, which has a 19⁄20 chance of choking you unless you are unbreathing.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

The following new amulets were added. Both auto-identify when worn, except the amulet of flying if you were already flying. The probabilities of other amulets have been adjusted: ESP to 12%; strangulation, restful sleep, versus poison, change to 11.5%; live saving, magical breathing to 7.5%; unchanging to 6%.
Amulet Relative probability When eaten Notes
amulet of flying 7.5% (no effect)
amulet of guarding 6.0% +2 protection (+2 AC, +2 MC) May be worn by monsters.

Identification

All amulets cost 150zm and weigh 20, so they cannot be distinguished using price identification. The appearance of the first 9 types of amulet in the table are randomized from the following descriptions: 

circular    spherical   oval       
triangular  pyramidal   square 
concave     hexagonal   octagonal

Non-cursed amulets are safe to try on; the effect may become obvious after a while, such as for the amulet of ESP, and you can always remove it if it is strangulation or restful sleep. The only risk is a small chance of changing genders, which does not have an effect on gameplay for the most part. Once strangulation and restful sleep are ruled out, even cursed amulets can be worn safely and beneficially as long as you don't have another amulet you'd rather be wearing instead.

Amulets of change and strangulation always formally identify themselves when worn. Every other amulet (other than the real and fake Amulets of Yendor) adds a line to the enlightenment screen, although some lines can have other sources:

Amulet of... produces the line... Other sources
ESP "You are telepathic." Helm of telepathy, some quest artifacts, intrinsic
life saving "Your life will be saved." none
magical breathing "You can survive without air." none
reflection "You have reflection." silver dragon scale mail, shield of reflection, wielded Longbow of Diana or wielded Dragonbane (3.6.1)
restful sleep "You fall asleep." none
unchanging "You can not change from your current form." none
versus poison "You are poison resistant." green dragon scale mail, ring of poison resistance, alchemy smock, intrinsic

In addition, intelligent monsters will only pick up and put on life saving (if living) and reflection.

In NetHack 3.4.3, Amulets of ESP can be identified using the artifact naming trick, because they cannot be named "The Eye of the Aethiopica". In NetHack 3.6.0, no amulet can be named "The Eye of the Aethiopica", so this method is ineffective at identifying amulets of ESP. Note that it is exploiting a bug that may be fixed in variants—including NAO version of NetHack. Additionally it may be considered cheating.

The real Amulet of Yendor, unlike the fakes, cannot be placed in a container ("The Amulet of Yendor cannot be confined in such trappings.")

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

The new amulet appearances are pentagonal and cubical.

Strategy

Amulets cannot be destroyed by electric shocks, so unless stolen by a nymph or monkey they are reliable at conferring their effect.

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM adds some more amulets.

Item Symbol Base type Notes
Amulet of flying " Randomized Grants flight.
Amulet of drain resistance " Randomized Grants level drain resistance.
Amulet versus stone " Randomized Saves your life if you're turned to stone, then alters its BUC status or disintegrates.

FIQHack

In FIQHack monsters can wear amulets.

Encyclopaedia entry

"The complete Amulet can keep off all the things that make people unhappy -- jealousy, bad temper, pride, disagreeableness, greediness, selfishness, laziness. Evil spirits, people called them when the Amulet was made. Don't you think it would be nice to have it?"
"Very," said the children, quite without enthusiasm.
"And it can give you strength and courage."
"That's better," said Cyril.
"And virtue."
"I suppose it's nice to have that," said Jane, but not with much interest.
"And it can give you your heart's desire."
"Now you're talking," said Robert.

[ The Story of the Amulet, by Edith Nesbit ]

References

  1. ↑ gethungry in eat.c

{{languages}}
{{items}}
An '''amulet''', also known as a '''medallion''', is a type of [[item]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]'' and is represented by a cyan [[double quotation mark]], {{cyan|"}}.

There are two [[artifact]] amulets: [[The Eye of the Aethiopica]] and the [[Amulet of Yendor]].

==Generation==
Amulets comprise 1% of all randomly-generated items in the main dungeon, 1% in containers, and 4% in [[Gehennom]]. The second column above is the relative probability of each subtype.

The ones generated 90.5% cursed are 9% uncursed and 0.5% blessed. All others are generated 5% cursed, 90% uncursed, 5% blessed.

The Amulet of Yendor is a [[unique item]] found only in [[Gehennom]], with fake counterparts appearing on the [[Rogue level]], in the inventories of certain high-level monsters, and in the bones files of people who had a real or fake Amulet themselves, where the real Amulet is replaced with a fake one.

==Description==
All amulets have a [[weight]] of 20, are made of [[iron]], and have a base price of 150 [[zorkmid]]s, with the exception of [[cheap plastic imitations of the Amulet of Yendor]] (made of [[plastic]] and worth nothing) and [[artifact]] amulets.

Amulets are [[put on]] around the wearer's neck, and a [[hero]] wearing the amulet will burn an extra 1 point of [[nutrition]] every 20 turns.{{reffunc|eat.c|gethungry}} Carrying the Amulet of Yendor consumes an additional 1 nutrition per 20 turns, regardless of whether the character is wearing it.

{{Upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|Wearing a [[cheap plastic imitation of the Amulet of Yendor]] no longer incurs amulet hunger.}}

!Amulet!!Relative probability!!When eaten!!Notes
|-
|[[amulet of flying]]||7.5%||''(no effect)''||
|-
|[[amulet of guarding]]||6.0%||+2 [[protection]] (+2 AC, +2 MC)||May be worn by monsters.
|}

==Identification==
All amulets cost 150[[zm]] and weigh 20, so they cannot be distinguished using [[price identification]]. The appearance of the first 9 types of amulet in the table are [[randomized appearance|randomized]] from the following descriptions:

 circular    spherical   oval       
 triangular  pyramidal   square 
 concave     hexagonal   octagonal

Non-cursed amulets are safe to try on; the effect may become obvious after a while, such as for the amulet of ESP, and you can always remove it if it is strangulation or restful sleep. The only risk is a small chance of changing genders, which does not have an effect on gameplay for the most part. Once strangulation and restful sleep are ruled out, even cursed amulets can be worn safely and beneficially as long as you don't have another amulet you'd rather be wearing instead.

Amulets of change and strangulation always formally identify themselves when worn.  Every other amulet (other than the real and fake Amulets of Yendor) adds a line to the [[enlightenment]] screen, although some lines can have other sources:

{|class="wikitable"
!Amulet of...
!produces the line...
!Other sources
|-
|ESP
|"You are telepathic."
|[[Helm of telepathy]], some quest artifacts, intrinsic
|-
|life saving
|"Your life will be saved."
|none
|-
|magical breathing
|"You can survive without air."
|none
|-
|reflection
|"You have reflection."
|silver [[dragon scale mail]], [[shield of reflection]], wielded [[Longbow of Diana]] or wielded [[Dragonbane]] (3.6.1)
|-
|restful sleep
|"You fall asleep."
|none
|-
|unchanging
|"You can not change from your current form."
|none
|-
|versus poison
|"You are poison resistant."
|green [[dragon scale mail]], [[ring of poison resistance]], [[alchemy smock]], intrinsic
|}

In addition, [[intelligent]] monsters will only pick up and put on life saving (if living) and reflection.

In NetHack 3.4.3, Amulets of ESP can be identified using the [[naming artifacts|artifact naming trick]], because they cannot be named "[[The Eye of the Aethiopica]]". In NetHack 3.6.0, no amulet can be named "The Eye of the Aethiopica", so this method is ineffective at identifying amulets of ESP. Note that it is exploiting a bug that may be fixed in [[variant]]s—including NAO version of NetHack. Additionally it may be considered [[cheating]].

The real Amulet of Yendor, unlike the fakes, cannot be placed in a container ("The Amulet of Yendor cannot be confined in such trappings.")

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|The new amulet appearances are pentagonal and cubical.}}

==Strategy==
Amulets cannot be destroyed by electric [[shock]]s, so unless stolen by a [[nymph]] or [[monkey]] they are reliable at conferring their effect.

=== FIQHack ===
In [[FIQHack]] monsters can wear amulets.

==Encyclopaedia entry==

{{encyclopedia|
"The complete Amulet can keep off all the things that make people unhappy -- jealousy, bad temper, pride, disagreeableness, greediness, selfishness, laziness.  Evil spirits, people called them when the Amulet was made.  Don't you think it would be nice to have it?"
"Very," said the children, quite without enthusiasm.
"And it can give you strength and courage."
"That's better," said Cyril.
"And virtue."
"I suppose it's nice to have that," said Jane, but not with much interest.
"And it can give you your heart's desire."
"Now you're talking," said Robert.
|[ The Story of the Amulet, by Edith Nesbit ]
}}
